KeysToEntries.Quest.Name: Growing Pains
KeysToEntries.Quest.Description: Learn the basics of the Farming skill from the Wise Old Man.
KeysToEntries.Objective.SpeakToWOM1: Speak to the Wise Old Man, in Bramblemead, to learn about the Farming skill.
KeysToEntries.Objective.HarvestCrop: Grow and harvest your first crop from a farming plot.
KeysToEntries.Objective.FinishQuest: Return to the Wise Old Man in Bramblemead.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.IntroFirstTime: What would you like to know?
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.IntroReturn: Anything else I can help you with?
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.PlantingSeeds.1: First, you'll need to build a farming plot. Use a spade on it to clear it of weeds. Once it's completely clear, you're ready to plant.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.PlantingSeeds.2: Just grab the seeds in your hand, and then whack em into the soil. No need for grace, or ceremony, just whomp them in and they'll be fine.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Watering.1: Plants are like people, they need water to survive. You'll want to keep your plants nice and hydrated, so that they don't succumb to disease.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Watering.2: Grab yourself a watering can, fill it with water at a water source, and then liberally douse your patch until it's fully soaked through.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Watering.3: Make sure to water your plants every day, ideally first thing in the morning, to keep them nice and healthy.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Compost.1: Compost improves the yield on your crops when you harvest them. They simply love to spread their roots around in the stinky stuff.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Compost.2: To make compost, you'll first need to build a Compost Bin. Then you'll want to fill it with compostible ingredients, like weeds, unwanted logs or irritating exes.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Compost.3: Give it a little time for the newly added stuff to rot down into compost and then take a Compost Bucket and fill it up.
KeysToEntries.WoM.QuestionHub.Compost.4: Then just pour the contents of your bucket over the farming plot, making sure it's spread over it as fully as possible.
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.Intro.1: I see you've started to get a little green around the thumbs! Farming will make survival on Ashenfall a little less horrible.
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.Intro.2: You'll be able to grow fruits, vegetables, and all manner of plants. Food, potion ingredients and perhaps some crafting resources too!
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.Intro.3: Why don't you go and give it a proper go right now? Go harvest some crops and then come back and see me. I'll give you a little something for your efforts.
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.Intro.4: Here, take these to get you started.
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.NoInventorySpace: Oh? You've overburdened yourself with all the random things you can cram in your pockets. Come back and see me when you've made a bit of room.
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.Finished.1: Look at you, practically master farmer already. Farming is a wonderful way to keep yourself well fed, and with access to useful materials.
KeysToEntries.WoM.TalkAboutFarming.Finished.2: Speaking of useful, here, take this. My little gift to you. Just don't tell the others, they'll get all jealous again.
KeysToEntries.FlavourText_FinishedFarmingTutorialPack: A cloth bag with some useful items for farmers.
KeysToEntries.FlavourText_FarmingTutorialPack: Contains different types of seeds from brynmoor.
